definition: to crowdsource information about sb or sth (abbr. for 人肉搜索[ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3])/human (used attributively, as in 人肉盾牌[ren2 rou4 dun4 pai2], human shield)
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to crowdsource information about sb or sth (often as a form of vigilantism resulting in doxing)
human flesh search engine/a large-scale collective effort to find details about a person or event (Internet slang)
pinyin: ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3 yin3 qing2

sentences.english: Did the authorities kill them because they'd eaten human flesh?
sentences.chinese: 当局有没有因为它们吃了人肉而把它们杀掉？

sentences.english: Cannibals captured him and took them to their village.
sentences.chinese: 那里食人肉的野蛮人抓住了他，把他带到住处。

sentences.english: Hu Bin's family members were also targeted by human flesh search.
sentences.chinese: 胡斌的家人们也是人肉搜索的目标。

sentences.english: Eating human flesh is a taboo in civilized countries.
sentences.chinese: 在文明国家，吃人肉是一种禁忌。

sentences.english: They satirized her plastic surgeries and gossiped about her whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 他们讽刺她做过整形手术，又不断人肉她的所在位置。

sentences.english: Human flesh would be a very dark purple, gold might look best with a brighter green.
sentences.chinese: 人肉将是一个暗紫色，金子也许看来最好是亮绿色。

sentences.english: Thanks to the human-powered search, those immoral people have been made public.
sentences.chinese: 由于有了人肉搜索，这些缺乏道德的人被公诸于众。

sentences.english: Patties made from minced human flesh were on sale at the Leningrad Haymarket .
sentences.chinese: 列宁格勒秣市场上出售的小馅饼，就是以碎人肉作馅。

sentences.english: All the civilized people can't be cannibals .
sentences.chinese: 凡是文明人不可能吃人肉。

sentences.english: However, great white sharks don't actually have a taste for human flesh4.
sentences.chinese: 不过大白鲨其实并不喜欢吃人肉。

sentences.english: It was spread because the tribespeople indulged in ritual cannibalism.
sentences.chinese: 该病的传播是由于部族人过度地按宗教仪式嗜食人肉。

sentences.english: Not maleficent, do not worry to be searched by person pork?
sentences.chinese: 不做坏事，就不担心被人肉搜索？

sentences.english: But I didn't want the girls to be hunted and get hurt.
sentences.chinese: 但我不希望这些女生被人肉搜出，受到伤害。

sentences.english: My uncle who had travelled to many countries in the world told a grisly story about people who ate human flesh.
sentences.chinese: 我那遍游世界各地的舅舅说了一个吃人肉的可怕故事。

sentences.english: In these films, the fish have an insatiable appetite for human flesh exclusively.
sentences.chinese: 在这些影片中，食人鱼非常喜食人肉。

sentences.english: You kind of doubt whether vegetarians would eat human flesh.
sentences.chinese: 你不相信素食者会吃人肉。

definition: minced meat sauce/(fig.) mincemeat/a person cut to pieces
to flay/to skin/(fig.) to exploit/to take advantage of
to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
to crowdsource information about sb or sth (often as a form of vigilantism resulting in doxing)
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
